required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Precision Therapy in Complex High-risk Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Registry of the Intracoronary Physiology and Imaging-guided Precision Therapy in Complex High-risk Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective registry to enroll complex high-risk coronary heart disease patients.
The purpose of this study is to compare intracoronary physiology and imaging-guided intervention strategy and angiography-guided intervention strategy for clinical outcomes and health economics.

primary_outcome.description: Composite ischemic event is defined as the composite of cardiac death, stent thrombosis, nonfatal myocardial infarction or ischemic driven revascularization.

intervention.description: Intracoronary physiology and imaging-guided intervention strategy versus angiography-guided intervention strategy for complex high-risk coronary heart disease patients

study_pop.textblock: Coronary heart disease patients with complicated clinical conditions and/or complex coronary lesions.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Xi'an Jiaotong University
